info.title: Wikimedia REST API
info.description:
This API provides cacheable and straightforward access to Wikimedia content and data, in machine-readable formats.
### Global Rules
- Limit your clients to no more than 200 requests/s to this API.
  Each API endpoint's documentation may detail more specific usage limits.
- Set a unique `User-Agent` or `Api-User-Agent` header that
  allows us to contact you quickly. Email addresses or URLs
  of contact pages work well.

By using this API, you agree to Wikimedia's [Terms of Use](https://wikimediafoundation.org/wiki/Terms_of_Use) and [Privacy Policy](https://wikimediafoundation.org/wiki/Privacy_policy). Unless otherwise specified in the endpoint documentation below, content accessed via this API is licensed under the [CC-BY-SA 3.0](https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/3.0/) and [GFDL](https://www.gnu.org/copyleft/fdl.html) licenses, and you irrevocably agree to release modifications or additions made through this API under these licenses. Check the [Wikimedia REST API documentation](https://www.mediawiki.org/wiki/Wikimedia_REST_API) for background and details.
### Endpoint documentation
Please consult each endpoint's documentation for details on:
- Licensing information for the specific type of content
  and data served via the endpoint.
- Stability markers to inform you about development status and
  change policy, according to
  [our API version policy](https://www.mediawiki.org/wiki/API_versioning).
- Endpoint specific usage limits.

200.description: A list of page-related API end points.

get.summary: Get revision metadata for a title.
get.description:
Returns the revision metadata for the given title. If a revision ID is provided,
metadata for that revision is returned, otherwise the latest revision ID is assumed.

Stability: [stable](https://www.mediawiki.org/wiki/API_versioning#Stable).

parameters.name: title
parameters.description: Page title. Use underscores instead of spaces. Use percent-encoding. Example: `Main_Page`.

200.description: The latest revision metadata for the provided title.

301.description:
A permanent redirect is returned if the supplied article title was not in the normalized form.
To avoid these redirects, you can use the [mediawiki-title](https://github.com/wikimedia/mediawiki-title) library to perform
title normalization client side.

Beware that redirected pre-flighted cross-origin requests (such as those sending custom request headers like `Api-User-Agent`)
will fail in most current browsers [due to a spec bug](https://github.com/whatwg/fetch/issues/204).

302.description:
The page is a [redirect page](https://www.mediawiki.org/wiki/Help:Redirects).
The `location` header points to the redirect target.
If you would like to avoid automatically following redirect pages, set the `redirect=false` query parameter.

Beware that redirected pre-flighted cross-origin requests (such as those sending custom request headers like `Api-User-Agent`)
will fail in most current browsers [due to a spec bug](https://github.com/whatwg/fetch/issues/204).

404.description: Unknown page title or no revisions found.

x-amples.title: Get rev by title from storage

get.summary: Get revision metadata for a title.
get.description:
Returns the revision metadata for the given title. If a revision ID is provided,
metadata for that revision is returned, otherwise the latest revision ID is assumed.

Stability: [stable](https://www.mediawiki.org/wiki/API_versioning#Stable).

parameters.name: title
parameters.description: Page title. Use underscores instead of spaces. Use percent-encoding. Example: `Main_Page`.

parameters.name: revision
parameters.description: The revision id

200.description: The latest revision metadata for the provided title.

301.description:
A permanent redirect is returned if the supplied article title was not in the normalized form.
To avoid these redirects, you can use the [mediawiki-title](https://github.com/wikimedia/mediawiki-title) library to perform
title normalization client side.

Beware that redirected pre-flighted cross-origin requests (such as those sending custom request headers like `Api-User-Agent`)
will fail in most current browsers [due to a spec bug](https://github.com/whatwg/fetch/issues/204).

302.description:
The page is a [redirect page](https://www.mediawiki.org/wiki/Help:Redirects).
The `location` header points to the redirect target.
If you would like to avoid automatically following redirect pages, set the `redirect=false` query parameter.

Beware that redirected pre-flighted cross-origin requests (such as those sending custom request headers like `Api-User-Agent`)
will fail in most current browsers [due to a spec bug](https://github.com/whatwg/fetch/issues/204).

404.description: Unknown page title or no revisions found.

x-amples.title: Get rev by title from storage

get.summary: Get latest HTML for a title.

parameters.name: title
parameters.description: Page title. Use underscores instead of spaces. Use percent-encoding. Example: `Main_Page`.

parameters.name: redirect
parameters.description:
Requests for [redirect pages](https://www.mediawiki.org/wiki/Help:Redirects) return HTTP 302 with a redirect target in `Location` header and content in the body.
To get a 200 response instead, supply `false` to the `redirect` parameter.

parameters.name: stash
parameters.description:
Whether to temporary stash data-parsoid in order to support transforming the
modified content later. If this parameter is set, requests are rate-limited on
a per-client basis (max 5 requests per second per client)

parameters.name: Accept-Language
parameters.description: The desired language variant code for wikis where LanguageConverter is enabled. Example: `sr-el` for Latin transcription of the Serbian language.

200.description:
The latest HTML for the given page title.

See [the MediaWiki DOM
spec](https://www.mediawiki.org/wiki/Parsoid/MediaWiki_DOM_spec) for a
description of the MediaWiki-specific semantic markup in this HTML.
Note that additional metadata is available in the HTML head.

ETag.description:
ETag header indicating the revision and render timeuuid
separated by a slash:
"701384379/154d7bca-c264-11e5-8c2f-1b51b33b59fc"
This ETag can be passed to the HTML save end point (as
`base_etag` POST parameter), and can also be used to retrieve
the exact corresponding data-parsoid metadata, by requesting
the specific `revision` and `tid` indicated by the `ETag`.

301.description:
A permanent redirect is returned if the supplied article title was not in the normalized form.
To avoid this kind of redirect, you can use the [mediawiki-title](https://github.com/wikimedia/mediawiki-title) library to perform
title normalization client-side.

Beware that redirected pre-flighted cross-origin requests (such as those sending custom request headers like `Api-User-Agent`)
will fail in most current browsers [due to a spec bug](https://github.com/whatwg/fetch/issues/204).

302.description:
The page is a [redirect page](https://www.mediawiki.org/wiki/Help:Redirects).
The `location` header points to the redirect target, and the body contains the actual page contents as HTML.
If you would like to avoid automatically following redirect pages, set the `redirect=false` query parameter.

Beware that redirected pre-flighted cross-origin requests (such as those sending custom request headers like `Api-User-Agent`)
will fail in most current browsers [due to a spec bug](https://github.com/whatwg/fetch/issues/204).

x-amples.title: Get html by title from storage

get.summary: Get HTML for a specific title/revision & optionally timeuuid.

parameters.name: title
parameters.description: Page title. Use underscores instead of spaces. Use percent-encoding. Example: `Main_Page`.

parameters.name: revision
parameters.description: The revision

parameters.name: redirect
parameters.description:
Requests for [redirect pages](https://www.mediawiki.org/wiki/Help:Redirects) return HTTP 302 with a redirect target in `Location` header and content in the body.
To get a 200 response instead, supply `false` to the `redirect` parameter.

parameters.name: stash
parameters.description:
Whether to temporary stash data-parsoid in order to support transforming the
modified content later. If this parameter is set, requests are rate-limited on
a per-client basis (max 5 requests per second per client)

parameters.name: Accept-Language
parameters.description: The desired language variant code for wikis where LanguageConverter is enabled. Example: `sr-el` for Latin transcription of the Serbian language.

200.description:
The html for the given page, revision and tid.

See [the MediaWiki DOM
spec](https://www.mediawiki.org/wiki/Parsoid/MediaWiki_DOM_spec) for a
description of the MediaWiki-specific semantic markup in this HTML.
Note that additional metadata is available in the HTML head.

This HTML can be edited using arbitrary HTML tools. The modified HTML
can be converted back to wikitext using the
[/transform/html/to/wikitext{/title}{/revision}](#!/Transforms/transform_html_to_wikitext__title___revision__post)
entry point.

ETag.description:
ETag header indicating the revision and render timeuuid
separated by a slash:
"701384379/154d7bca-c264-11e5-8c2f-1b51b33b59fc"
This ETag can be passed to the HTML save end point (as
`base_etag` POST parameter), and can also be used to retrieve
the exact corresponding data-parsoid metadata, by requesting
the specific `revision` and `tid` indicated by the `ETag`.

301.description:
A permanent redirect is returned if the supplied article title was not in the normalized form.
To avoid this kind of redirect, you can use the [mediawiki-title](https://github.com/wikimedia/mediawiki-title) library to perform
title normalization client-side.

Beware that redirected pre-flighted cross-origin requests (such as those sending custom request headers like `Api-User-Agent`)
will fail in most current browsers [due to a spec bug](https://github.com/whatwg/fetch/issues/204).

302.description:
The page is a [redirect page](https://www.mediawiki.org/wiki/Help:Redirects).
The `location` header points to the redirect target, and the body contains the actual page revision contents as HTML.
If you would like to avoid automatically following redirect pages, set the `redirect=false` query parameter.

Beware that redirected pre-flighted cross-origin requests (such as those sending custom request headers like `Api-User-Agent`)
will fail in most current browsers [due to a spec bug](https://github.com/whatwg/fetch/issues/204).

403.description: Access to the specific revision is restricted

get.summary: Get data-parsoid metadata for a specific title/revision/tid.
get.description:
Data-parsoid is metadata used by
[Parsoid](https://www.mediawiki.org/wiki/Parsoid) to support clean
round-tripping conversions between HTML and Wikitext. Among other
things, it contains the original Wikitext offsets of each HTML
element, keyed by element ID. The format is unstable.

The metadata in data-parsoid is specific to a specific HTML render.
For this reason, you need to supply the exact `revision` and `tid` as
provided in the `ETag` header of the HTML response.

Stability: [Stable](https://www.mediawiki.org/wiki/API_versioning#Stable)

parameters.name: title
parameters.description: Page title. Use underscores instead of spaces. Use percent-encoding. Example: `Main_Page`.

parameters.name: revision
parameters.description: The revision

parameters.name: tid
parameters.description: The revision's time ID

parameters.name: redirect
parameters.description:
Requests for [redirect pages](https://www.mediawiki.org/wiki/Help:Redirects) return HTTP 302 with a redirect target in `Location` header and content in the body.
To get a 200 response instead, supply `false` to the `redirect` parameter.

200.description: The latest Parsoid data for the given page

301.description:
A permanent redirect is returned if the supplied article title was not in the normalized form.
To avoid this kind of redirect, you can use the [mediawiki-title](https://github.com/wikimedia/mediawiki-title) library to perform
title normalization client-side.

Beware that redirected pre-flighted cross-origin requests (such as those sending custom request headers like `Api-User-Agent`)
will fail in most current browsers [due to a spec bug](https://github.com/whatwg/fetch/issues/204).

302.description:
The page is a [redirect page](https://www.mediawiki.org/wiki/Help:Redirects).
The `location` header points to the redirect target, and the body contains the actual data-parsoid for the redirect page.
If you would like to avoid automatically following redirect pages, set the `redirect=false` query parameter.

Beware that redirected pre-flighted cross-origin requests (such as those sending custom request headers like `Api-User-Agent`)
will fail in most current browsers [due to a spec bug](https://github.com/whatwg/fetch/issues/204).

403.description: Access to the specific revision is restricted

get.summary: Get the linter errors for a specific title/revision.

parameters.name: title
parameters.description: Page title. Use underscores instead of spaces. Use percent-encoding. Example: `Main_Page`.

200.description:
The lint errors for the given page and optionally revision.

See [the Linter extension docs](https://www.mediawiki.org/wiki/Extension:Linter) for more
details.

301.description:
A permanent redirect is returned if the supplied article title was not in the normalized form.
To avoid this kind of redirect, you can use the [mediawiki-title](https://github.com/wikimedia/mediawiki-title) library to perform
title normalization client-side.

Beware that redirected pre-flighted cross-origin requests (such as those sending custom request headers like `Api-User-Agent`)
will fail in most current browsers [due to a spec bug](https://github.com/whatwg/fetch/issues/204).

302.description:
The page is a [redirect page](https://www.mediawiki.org/wiki/Help:Redirects).

If you would like to avoid automatically following redirect pages, set the `redirect=false` query parameter.

Beware that redirected pre-flighted cross-origin requests (such as those sending custom request headers like `Api-User-Agent`)
will fail in most current browsers [due to a spec bug](https://github.com/whatwg/fetch/issues/204).

403.description: Access to the specific revision is restricted

get.summary: Get the linter errors for a specific title/revision.

parameters.name: title
parameters.description: Page title. Use underscores instead of spaces. Use percent-encoding. Example: `Main_Page`.

parameters.name: revision
parameters.description: The revision

200.description:
The lint errors for the given page and optionally revision.

See [the Linter extension docs](https://www.mediawiki.org/wiki/Extension:Linter) for more
details.

301.description:
A permanent redirect is returned if the supplied article title was not in the normalized form.
To avoid this kind of redirect, you can use the [mediawiki-title](https://github.com/wikimedia/mediawiki-title) library to perform
title normalization client-side.

Beware that redirected pre-flighted cross-origin requests (such as those sending custom request headers like `Api-User-Agent`)
will fail in most current browsers [due to a spec bug](https://github.com/whatwg/fetch/issues/204).

302.description:
The page is a [redirect page](https://www.mediawiki.org/wiki/Help:Redirects).
The `location` header points to the redirect target, and the body contains the actual page revision contents as HTML.
If you would like to avoid automatically following redirect pages, set the `redirect=false` query parameter.

Beware that redirected pre-flighted cross-origin requests (such as those sending custom request headers like `Api-User-Agent`)
will fail in most current browsers [due to a spec bug](https://github.com/whatwg/fetch/issues/204).

403.description: Access to the specific revision is restricted

post.description:
Transform [Parsoid HTML](https://www.mediawiki.org/wiki/Parsoid/MediaWiki_DOM_spec)
to Wikitext.

When converting pre-existing (possibly modified) content, you should
pass in the `title`, `revision`, and `If-Match` header. This lets
[Parsoid](https://www.mediawiki.org/wiki/Parsoid) preserve small
syntactic variations in wikitext, which ensures that diffs are
readable.

- Stability: [stable](https://www.mediawiki.org/wiki/API_versioning#Stable)
- Rate limit: 25 req/s

parameters.name: if-match
parameters.description:
The `ETag` header of the original render indicating it's revision and timeuuid.
Required if both `title` and `revision` parameters are present.

scrub_wikitext.description: Normalise the DOM to yield cleaner wikitext?

200.description: MediaWiki Wikitext.

403.description: Access to the specific revision is restricted

post.description:
Transform wikitext to HTML. Note that if you set `stash: true`, you
also need to supply the title.

- Stability: [stable](https://www.mediawiki.org/wiki/API_versioning#Stable)
- Rate limit: 25 req/s (5 req/s when `stash: true`)

wikitext.description: The Wikitext to transform to HTML

stash.description: Whether to temporarily stash the result of the transformation

200.description: See wikipage https://www.mediawiki.org/wiki/Parsoid/MediaWiki_DOM_spec

403.description: access to the specific revision is restricted

post.description:
Parse the supplied wikitext and check it for lint errors.

- Stability: [experimental](https://www.mediawiki.org/wiki/API_versioning#Experimental)
- Rate limit: 25 req/s

200.description: Linter errors, if any, as a JSON blob

Parse the supplied wikitext and check it for lint errors.

- Stability: [experimental](https://www.mediawiki.org/wiki/API_versioning#Experimental)
- Rate limit: 25 req/s

200.description: Linter errors, if any, as a JSON blob

parameters.name: title
parameters.description: Page title. Use underscores instead of spaces. Use percent-encoding. Example: `Main_Page`.

- Stability: [experimental](https://www.mediawiki.org/wiki/API_versioning#Experimental)
- Rate limit: 25 req/s

200.description: Linter errors, if any, as a JSON blob

parameters.name: title
parameters.description: Page title. Use underscores instead of spaces. Use percent-encoding. Example: `Main_Page`.

parameters.name: revision
parameters.description: The page revision

post.summary: Check and normalize a TeX formula.
post.description:
Checks the supplied TeX formula for correctness and returns the
normalised formula representation as well as information about
identifiers. Available types are tex and inline-tex. The response
contains the `x-resource-location` header which can be used to retrieve
the render of the checked formula in one of the supported rendering
formats. Just append the value of the header to `/media/math/{format}/`
and perform a GET request against that URL.

**NOTE**: the use of this endpoint is *strongly discouraged*. Instead, use the identical endpoint of the (canonical) Math API on the `wikimedia.org` domain.

Stability: [deprecated](https://www.mediawiki.org/wiki/API_versioning#Deprecated).

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: The input type of the given formula; can be tex or inline-tex

200.description: Information about the checked formula

get.description:
Returns the previously-stored formula via `/media/math/check/{type}` for
the given hash.

**NOTE**: the use of this endpoint is *strongly discouraged*. Instead, use the identical endpoint of the (canonical) Math API on the `wikimedia.org` domain.

Stability: [deprecated](https://www.mediawiki.org/wiki/API_versioning#Deprecated).

parameters.name: hash
parameters.description: The hash string of the previous POST data

200.description: Information about the checked formula

404.description: Data for the given hash cannot be found

get.summary: Get rendered formula in the given format.
get.description:
Given a request hash, renders a TeX formula into its mathematic
representation in the given format. When a request is issued to the
`/media/math/check/{format}` POST endpoint, the response contains the
`x-resource-location` header denoting the hash ID of the POST data. Once
obtained, this endpoint has to be used to obtain the actual render.

**NOTE**: the use of this endpoint is *strongly discouraged*. Instead, use the identical endpoint of the (canonical) Math API on the `wikimedia.org` domain.

Stability: [deprecated](https://www.mediawiki.org/wiki/API_versioning#Deprecated).

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: The output format; can be svg or mml

parameters.name: hash
parameters.description: The hash string of the previous POST data

200.description: The rendered formula

post.summary: Opt in to use reading lists.
post.description:
Must precede other list operations.

Request must be authenticated with a MediaWiki session cookie.

Stability: [unstable](https://www.mediawiki.org/wiki/API_versioning#Unstable)

parameters.name: csrf_token
parameters.description: The CRSF edit token provided by the MediaWiki API

200.description: Success.

post.summary: Opt out from using reading lists.
post.description:
Deletes all data. User needs to opt in again before being able to do anything.

Request must be authenticated with a MediaWiki session cookie.

Stability: [unstable](https://www.mediawiki.org/wiki/API_versioning#Unstable)

parameters.name: csrf_token
parameters.description: The CRSF edit token provided by the MediaWiki API

200.description: Success.

get.summary: Get all lists of the current user.
get.description:
Returns metadata describing the lists of the current user. Might be truncated and include
a continuation token.

Request must be authenticated with a MediaWiki session cookie.

Stability: [unstable](https://www.mediawiki.org/wiki/API_versioning#Unstable)

parameters.name: next
parameters.description: Continuation parameter from previous request

parameters.name: sort

200.description: An array of list metadata.

continue-from.description:
Timestamp to sync from, to be used with the `GET /lists/changes/since/{date}`
endpoint.

post.summary: Create a new list for the current user.
post.description:
Creates a new empty list. On name conflict, does nothing and returns the data of an
existing list.

Request must be authenticated with a MediaWiki session cookie.

Stability: [unstable](https://www.mediawiki.org/wiki/API_versioning#Unstable)

This endpoint is deprecated and might be removed without warning. Use the batch version
instead.

parameters.name: csrf_token
parameters.description: The CRSF edit token provided by the MediaWiki API

200.description: The data for the new list.

id.description:
List ID.

Deprecated, will be removed. Use the full list object.

put.description:
List must belong to current user and request must be authenticated with
a MediaWiki session cookie. If the name is changed, the new name must not be in use.

Stability: [unstable](https://www.mediawiki.org/wiki/API_versioning#Unstable)

parameters.name: csrf_token
parameters.description: The CRSF edit token provided by the MediaWiki API

200.description: The updated data for the list.

id.description:
List ID.

Deprecated, will be removed. Use the full list object.

delete.description:
List must belong to current user and request must be authenticated with
a MediaWiki session cookie.

Stability: [unstable](https://www.mediawiki.org/wiki/API_versioning#Unstable)

200.description: Success.

post.summary: Create multiple new lists for the current user.

parameters.name: csrf_token
parameters.description: The CRSF edit token provided by the MediaWiki API

200.description: The data for the new lists (in the same order as the inputs).

batch.description: Deprecated, will be removed. Use the full list objects instead.

get.summary: Get all entries of a given list.
get.description:
Returns pages contained by the given list. Might be truncated and include
a continuation token.

List must belong to current user and request must be authenticated with
a MediaWiki session cookie.

Stability: [unstable](https://www.mediawiki.org/wiki/API_versioning#Unstable)

parameters.name: next
parameters.description: Continuation parameter from previous request

parameters.name: sort

200.description: An array of list entries.

post.description:
Creates a new list entry in the given list. On conflict, does nothing and returns the
data of an existing list.

The list must belong to the current user and the request must be
authenticated with a MediaWiki session cookie.

Stability: [unstable](https://www.mediawiki.org/wiki/API_versioning#Unstable)

This endpoint is deprecated and might be removed without warning. Use the batch version
instead.

parameters.name: csrf_token
parameters.description: The CRSF edit token provided by the MediaWiki API

200.description: The data for the new list entry.

id.description:
List entry ID

Deprecated, will be removed. Use the full entry object instead.

delete.description:
Deletes a given list entry.

The list must belong to the current user and the request must be
authenticated with a MediaWiki session cookie.

Stability: [unstable](https://www.mediawiki.org/wiki/API_versioning#Unstable)

200.description: Success.

parameters.name: csrf_token
parameters.description: The CRSF edit token provided by the MediaWiki API

200.description: The data for the new list entries (in the same order as the inputs).

get.summary: Get lists of the current user which contain a given page.
get.description:
Request must be authenticated with a MediaWiki session cookie.

Stability: [unstable](https://www.mediawiki.org/wiki/API_versioning#Unstable)

schema.description: Domain of the wiki containing the page.
Title of the page containing the page, in database format.

parameters.name: next
parameters.description: Continuation parameter from previous request

200.description: An array of list metadata.

get.summary: Get recent changes to the lists
get.description:
Returns metadata describing lists and entries which have changed. Might be truncated
and include a continuation token.

Request must be authenticated with a MediaWiki session cookie.

For safe synchronization, the date parameter should be taken from the `continue-from`
field of a previous `GET /lists/` or `GET /lists/changes/since/{date}` request. This will
ensure that no changes are skipped, at the cost of sometimes receiving the same change
multitple times. Clients should handle changes in an idempotent way.

Stability: [unstable](https://www.mediawiki.org/wiki/API_versioning#Unstable)

parameters.name: date
parameters.description:
Cutoff date (in ISO 8601). To ensure reliable synchronization, the API
might return changes which are slightly older than the cutoff date.

parameters.name: next
parameters.description: Continuation parameter from previous request

200.description: An array of list and entry metadata.

continue-from.description:
Timestamp to sync from, to be used with the `GET /lists/changes/since/{date}`
endpoint.

get.summary: Recommend Wikibase items missing a description in the target language

parameters.name: target
parameters.description: The target wiki language code for suggestions

200.description: list of candidates for description addition

get.summary: Recommend Wikibase items with a description in the source language but missing one in the target language

parameters.name: source
parameters.description: The source wiki language code for suggestions

parameters.name: target
parameters.description: The target wiki language code for suggestions

200.description: list of candidates for description translation

revisions.description: The result format for revision listing

href.description: Relative link to next result page.

data-parsoid.description: Result format for Parsoid data queries

titles_set.description: a good example of the differences can be seen in https://en.wikipedia.org/api/rest_v1/page/summary/IOS_13

canonical.description: the DB key (non-prefixed), e.g. may have _ instead of spaces, best for making request URIs, still requires Percent-encoding

normalized.description: the normalized title (https://www.mediawiki.org/wiki/API:Query#Example_2:_Title_normalization), e.g. may have spaces instead of _

display.description: the title as it should be displayed to the user

title.description:
The page title.
Deprecated: Use `titles.normalized` instead.

displaytitle.description:
The page title how it should be shown to the user.
Deprecated: Use `titles.display` instead.

extract.description: First several sentences of an article in plain text

extract_html.description: First several sentences of an article in simple HTML format

timestamp.description: The time when the page was last edited in the [ISO 8601](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601) format

source.description: the original word to look up

sources.description: the source dictionary used for the translation

project.description: Domain of the wiki containing the page.

title.description: Title of the page containing the page, in database format.
